answers.answer: the retroverted uterus should not affect anything.  it is very common.  a septated uterus may make it harder to conceive or carry a pregnancy.  i don't think either of these would cause birth defects but the septated uterus may cause miscarriage.

I have both of these, I have had 3 children and am currently pregnant with twins!! One in each horn :) I never had any additional problems or early labour. I had gestational diabetes but not because of my uterus and either of my children aave any birth defects xx
Also my first born weighed 10lb7 8 days late, 2nd 9lb5.5 8 days early (planned section because of  sons weight) 3rd 10lb7.5 (2 weeks early because of daughters weight)

question: What problems during conception/pregnancy/delivery etc., may occur for someone who has both a retroverted uterus, as well as a bicornuate or septated uterus.  Are my chances of having a baby with birth defects higher than average?
title: Retroverted and Bicornuate Uterus
